pagerduty-datasource-escalation-policy.body:
data "pagerduty_escalation_policy" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name to use to find an escalation policy in the PagerDuty API.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the found escalation policy.
    # "name" - The short name of the found escalation policy.
}
pagerduty-datasource-escalation-policy.description: Use this data source to get information about a specific [escalation policy][1] that you can use for other PagerDuty resources.

pagerduty-datasource-extension-schema.body:
data "pagerduty_extension_schema" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The extension name to use to find an extension vendor in the PagerDuty API.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the found extension vendor.
    # "name" - The short name of the found extension vendor.
    # "type" - The generic service type for this extension vendor.
}
pagerduty-datasource-extension-schema.description: Use this data source to get information about a specific [extension][1] vendor that you can use for a service (e.g: Slack, Generic Webhook, ServiceNow).

pagerduty-datasource-schedule.body:
data "pagerduty_schedule" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name to use to find a schedule in the PagerDuty API.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the found schedule.
    # "name" - The short name of the found schedule.
}
pagerduty-datasource-schedule.description: Use this data source to get information about a specific [schedule][1] that you can use for other PagerDuty resources.

pagerduty-datasource-team.body:
data "pagerduty_team" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the team to find in the PagerDuty API.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the found team.
    # "name" - The name of the found team.
    # "description" - A description of the found team.
}
pagerduty-datasource-team.description: Use this data source to get information about a specific [team][1] that you can use for other PagerDuty resources.

pagerduty-datasource-user.body:
data "pagerduty_user" "$1" {
    # email - (Required) The email to use to find a user in the PagerDuty API.
    email = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the found user.
    # "name" - The short name of the found user.
}
pagerduty-datasource-user.description: Use this data source to get information about a specific [user][1] that you can use for other PagerDuty resources.

pagerduty-datasource-vendor.body:
data "pagerduty_vendor" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The vendor name to use to find a vendor in the PagerDuty API.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the found vendor.
    # "name" - The short name of the found vendor.
    # "type" - The generic service type for this vendor.
}
pagerduty-datasource-vendor.description: Use this data source to get information about a specific [vendor][1] that you can use for a service integration (e.g Amazon Cloudwatch, Splunk, Datadog).

pagerduty-resource-addon.body:
resource "pagerduty_addon" "$1" {
    # src - (Required) The source URL to display in a frame in the PagerDuty UI. `HTTPS` is required.
    src = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the add-on.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the add-on.
}
pagerduty-resource-addon.description: With [add-ons](https://v2.developer.pagerduty.com/v2/page/api-reference#!/Add-ons/get_addons), third-party developers can write their own add-ons to PagerDuty's UI. Given a configuration containing a src parameter, that URL will be embedded in an iframe on a page that's available to users from a drop-down menu.

pagerduty-resource-escalation-policy.body:
resource "pagerduty_escalation_policy" "$1" {
    # id - (Required) A target ID
    id = ""

    # targets - (Required) A target block. Target blocks documented below.
    targets = ""

    # escalation_delay_in_minutes - (Required) The number of minutes before an unacknowledged incident escalates away from this rule.
    escalation_delay_in_minutes = ""

    # rule - (Required) An Escalation rule block. Escalation rules documented below.
    rule = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the escalation policy.
    name = ""

    # teams - (Optional) Teams associated with the policy. Account must have the `teams` ability to use this parameter.
    teams = ""

    # description - (Optional) A human-friendly description of the escalation policy.
    description = ""

    # num_loops - (Optional) The number of times the escalation policy will repeat after reaching the end of its escalation.
    num_loops = ""

    # type - (Optional) Can be `user`, `schedule`, `user_reference` or `schedule_reference`. Defaults to `user_reference`
    type = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the escalation policy.
}
pagerduty-resource-escalation-policy.description: An [escalation policy](https://v2.developer.pagerduty.com/v2/page/api-reference#!/Escalation_Policies/get_escalation_policies) determines what user or schedule will be notified first, second, and so on when an incident is triggered. Escalation policies are used by one or more services.

pagerduty-resource-extension.body:
resource "pagerduty_extension" "$1" {
    # extension_objects - (Required) This is the objects for which the extension applies (An array of service ids).
    extension_objects = ""

    # extension_schema - (Required) This is the schema for this extension.
    extension_schema = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the service extension.
    name = ""

    # endpoint_url - (Optional) The url of the extension.
    endpoint_url = ""

    # config - (Optional) The configuration of the service extension as string containing plain JSON-encoded data. **Note:** You can use the `pagerduty_extension_schema` data source to locate the appropriate extension vendor ID. ## Attributes Reference
    config = ""

    # id - (Optional) The ID of the extension.
    id = ""

    # config - (Optional) The configuration of the service extension as string containing plain JSON-encoded data. **Note:** You can use the `pagerduty_extension_schema` data source to locate the appropriate extension vendor ID. ## Attributes Reference
    config = ""

    # html_url - (Optional) a URL at which the entity is uniquely displayed in the Web app
    html_url = ""

    # config - (Optional) The configuration of the service extension as string containing plain JSON-encoded data. **Note:** You can use the `pagerduty_extension_schema` data source to locate the appropriate extension vendor ID. ## Attributes Reference
    config = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
pagerduty-resource-extension.description: An [extension](https://v2.developer.pagerduty.com/v2/page/api-reference#!/Extensions/post_extensions) can be associated with a service.

pagerduty-resource-maintenance-window.body:
resource "pagerduty_maintenance_window" "$1" {
    # services - (Required) A list of service IDs to include in the maintenance window.
    services = ""

    # end_time - (Required) The maintenance window's end time. This is when the services will start creating incidents again. This date must be in the future and after the `start_time`.
    end_time = ""

    # start_time - (Required) The maintenance window's start time. This is when the services will stop creating incidents. If this date is in the past, it will be updated to be the current time.
    start_time = ""

    # description - (Optional) A description for the maintenance window.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the maintenance window.
}
pagerduty-resource-maintenance-window.description: A [maintenance window](https://v2.developer.pagerduty.com/v2/page/api-reference#!/Maintenance_Windows/get_maintenance_windows) is used to temporarily disable one or more services for a set period of time. No incidents will be triggered and no notifications will be received while a service is disabled by a maintenance window. Maintenance windows are specified to start at a certain time and end after they have begun. Once started, a maintenance window cannot be deleted; it can only be ended immediately to re-enable the service.

pagerduty-resource-schedule.body:
resource "pagerduty_schedule" "$1" {
    # duration_seconds - (Required) The duration of the restriction in `seconds`.
    duration_seconds = ""

    # start_time_of_day - (Required) The start time in `HH:mm:ss` format.
    start_time_of_day = ""

    # type - (Required) Can be `daily_restriction` or `weekly_restriction`
    type = ""

    # users - (Required) The ordered list of users on this layer. The position of the user on the list determines their order in the layer.
    users = ""

    # rotation_turn_length_seconds - (Required) The duration of each on-call shift in `seconds`.
    rotation_turn_length_seconds = ""

    # rotation_virtual_start - (Required) The effective start time of the schedule layer. This can be before the start time of the schedule.
    rotation_virtual_start = ""

    # start - (Required) The start time of the schedule layer. This value will not be read back from the PagerDuty API because the API will always return a new `start` time, which represents the last updated time of the schedule layer.
    start = ""

    # layer - (Required) A schedule layer block. Schedule layers documented below.
    layer = ""

    # time_zone - (Required) The time zone of the schedule (e.g Europe/Berlin).
    time_zone = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the schedule.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) The description of the schedule
    description = ""

    # overflow - (Optional) Any on-call schedule entries that pass the date range bounds will be truncated at the bounds, unless the parameter `overflow` is passed. For instance, if your schedule is a rotation that changes daily at midnight UTC, and your date range is from `2011-06-01T10:00:00Z` to `2011-06-01T14:00:00Z`:
    overflow = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the schedule layer.
    name = ""

    # end - (Optional) The end time of the schedule layer. If not specified, the layer does not end.
    end = ""

    # restriction - (Optional) A schedule layer restriction block. Restriction blocks documented below.
    restriction = ""

    # start_day_of_week - (Optional) (Required for `weekly_restriction`) Number of the day when restriction starts. From 1 to 7 where 1 is Monday and 7 is Sunday.
    start_day_of_week = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the schedule
}
pagerduty-resource-schedule.description: A [schedule](https://v2.developer.pagerduty.com/v2/page/api-reference#!/Schedules/get_schedules) determines the time periods that users are on call. Only on-call users are eligible to receive notifications from incidents.

pagerduty-resource-service.body:
resource "pagerduty_service" "$1" {
    # escalation_policy - (Required) The escalation policy used by this service.
    escalation_policy = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the service.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A human-friendly description of the service.
    description = ""

    # auto_resolve_timeout - (Optional) Time in seconds that an incident is automatically resolved if left open for that long. Disabled if set to the `"null"` string.
    auto_resolve_timeout = ""

    # acknowledgement_timeout - (Optional) Time in seconds that an incident changes to the Triggered State after being Acknowledged. Disabled if set to the `"null"` string.
    acknowledgement_timeout = ""

    # alert_creation - (Optional) Must be one of two values. PagerDuty receives events from your monitoring systems and can then create incidents in different ways. Value "create_incidents" is default: events will create an incident that cannot be merged. Value "create_alerts_and_incidents" is the alternative: events will create an alert and then add it to a new incident, these incidents can be merged.
    alert_creation = ""

    # type - (Optional) The type of incident urgency: `constant` or `use_support_hours` (when depending on specific support hours; see `support_hours`).
    type = ""

    # urgency - (Optional) The urgency: `low` (does not escalate), or `high` (follows escalation rules).
    urgency = ""

    # during_support_hours - (Optional) Incidents' urgency during support hours.
    during_support_hours = ""

    # outside_support_hours - (Optional) Incidents' urgency outside of support hours.
    outside_support_hours = ""

    # type - (Optional) The type of support hours. Can be `fixed_time_per_day`.
    type = ""

    # time_zone - (Optional) The time zone for the support hours.
    time_zone = ""

    # days_of_week - (Optional) Array of days of week as integers. `1` to `7`, `1` being
    days_of_week = ""

    # start_time - (Optional) The support hours' starting time of day.
    start_time = ""

    # end_time - (Optional) The support hours' ending time of day.
    end_time = ""

    # type - (Optional) The type of scheduled action. Currently, this must be set to `urgency_change`.
    type = ""

    # to_urgency - (Optional) The urgency to change to: `low` (does not escalate), or `high` (follows escalation rules).
    to_urgency = ""

    # at - (Optional) A block representing when the scheduled action will occur.
    at = ""

    # type - (Optional) The type of time specification. Currently, this must be set to `named_time`.
    type = ""

    # name - (Optional) Designates either the start or the end of the scheduled action. Can be `support_hours_start` or `support_hours_end`.
    name = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the service.
    # "last_incident_timestamp"- Last incident timestamp of the service
    # "created_at"- Creation timestamp of the service
    # "status"- The status of the service
}
pagerduty-resource-service.description: A [service](https://v2.developer.pagerduty.com/v2/page/api-reference#!/Services/get_services) represents something you monitor (like a web service, email service, or database service). It is a container for related incidents that associates them with escalation policies.

pagerduty-resource-service-integration.body:
resource "pagerduty_service_integration" "$1" {
    # service - (Required) The ID of the service the integration should belong to.
    service = ""

    # name - (Optional) The name of the service integration.
    name = ""

    # type - (Optional) The service type. Can be: `aws_cloudwatch_inbound_integration`, `cloudkick_inbound_integration`, `event_transformer_api_inbound_integration`, `events_api_v2_inbound_integration` (requires service `alert_creation` to be `create_alerts_and_incidents`), `generic_email_inbound_integration`, `generic_events_api_inbound_integration`, `keynote_inbound_integration`, `nagios_inbound_integration`, `pingdom_inbound_integration`or `sql_monitor_inbound_integration`. **Note:** This is meant for **generic** service integrations. To integrate with a **vendor** (e.g Datadog or Amazon Cloudwatch) use the `vendor` field instead.
    type = ""

    # vendor - (Optional) The ID of the vendor the integration should integrate with (e.g Datadog or Amazon Cloudwatch).
    vendor = ""

    # integration_key - (Optional) This is the unique key used to route events to this integration when received via the PagerDuty Events API.
    integration_key = ""

    # vendor - (Optional) The ID of the vendor the integration should integrate with (e.g Datadog or Amazon Cloudwatch).
    vendor = ""

    # integration_email - (Optional) This is the unique fully-qualified email address used for routing emails to this integration for processing. **Note:** You can use the `pagerduty_vendor` data source to locate the appropriate vendor ID. ## Attributes Reference
    integration_email = ""

    # id - (Optional) The ID of the service integration.
    id = ""

    # integration_email - (Optional) This is the unique fully-qualified email address used for routing emails to this integration for processing. **Note:** You can use the `pagerduty_vendor` data source to locate the appropriate vendor ID. ## Attributes Reference
    integration_email = ""

    # integration_key - (Optional) This is the unique key used to route events to this integration when received via the PagerDuty Events API.
    integration_key = ""

    # integration_email - (Optional) This is the unique fully-qualified email address used for routing emails to this integration for processing. **Note:** You can use the `pagerduty_vendor` data source to locate the appropriate vendor ID. ## Attributes Reference
    integration_email = ""

    # integration_email - (Optional) This is the unique fully-qualified email address used for routing emails to this integration for processing.
    integration_email = ""

    # integration_email - (Optional) This is the unique fully-qualified email address used for routing emails to this integration for processing. **Note:** You can use the `pagerduty_vendor` data source to locate the appropriate vendor ID. ## Attributes Reference
    integration_email = ""

    # html_url - (Optional) URL at which the entity is uniquely displayed in the Web app
    html_url = ""

    # integration_email - (Optional) This is the unique fully-qualified email address used for routing emails to this integration for processing. **Note:** You can use the `pagerduty_vendor` data source to locate the appropriate vendor ID. ## Attributes Reference
    integration_email = ""

    # Exported Attributes
}
pagerduty-resource-service-integration.description: A [service integration](https://v2.developer.pagerduty.com/v2/page/api-reference#!/Services/post_services_id_integrations) is an integration that belongs to a service.

pagerduty-resource-team.body:
resource "pagerduty_team" "$1" {
    # name - (Required) The name of the group.
    name = ""

    # description - (Optional) A human-friendly description of the team.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the team.
}
pagerduty-resource-team.description: A [team](https://v2.developer.pagerduty.com/v2/page/api-reference#!/Teams/get_teams) is a collection of users and escalation policies that represent a group of people within an organization. The account must have the `teams` ability to use the following resource.

pagerduty-resource-team-membership.body:
resource "pagerduty_team_membership" "$1" {
    # team_id - (Required) The ID of the team in which the user will belong.
    team_id = ""

    # user_id - (Required) The ID of the user to add to the team.
    user_id = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "user_id" - The ID of the user belonging to the team.
    # "team_id" - The team ID the user belongs to.
}
pagerduty-resource-team-membership.description: A [team membership](https://v2.developer.pagerduty.com/v2/page/api-reference#!/Teams/put_teams_id_users_user_id) manages memberships within a team.

pagerduty-resource-user.body:
resource "pagerduty_user" "$1" {
    # email - (Required) The user's email address.
    email = ""

    # name - (Required) The name of the user.
    name = ""

    # color - (Optional) The schedule color for the user. Valid options are blue, brown, cayenne, chocolate, crimson, cyan, dark, darkolive, deep, firebrick, forest, goldenrod, gray, green, grey, grey20, indigo, lime, magenta, maroon, medium, midnight, olive, olivedrab, orange, orchid, pink, purple, red, royal, saddle, sea, slate, steel, teal, turquoise or violet.
    color = ""

    # role - (Optional) The user role. Account must have the `read_only_users` ability to set a user as a `read_only_user`. Can be `admin`, `limited_user`, `owner`, `read_only_user`, `team_responder` or `user`
    role = ""

    # job_title - (Optional) The user's title.
    job_title = ""

    # teams - (Optional) A list of teams the user should belong to.
    teams = ""

    # description - (Optional) A human-friendly description of the user.
    description = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the user.
    # "avatar_url" - The URL of the user's avatar.
    # "time_zone" - The timezone of the user
    # "html_url" - URL at which the entity is uniquely displayed in the Web app
    # "invitation_sent" - If true, the user has an outstanding invitation.
}
pagerduty-resource-user.description: A [user](https://v2.developer.pagerduty.com/v2/page/api-reference#!/Users/get_users) is a member of a PagerDuty account that have the ability to interact with incidents and other data on the account.

pagerduty-resource-user-contact-method.body:
resource "pagerduty_user_contact_method" "$1" {
    # address - (Required) The "address" to deliver to: `email`, `phone number`, etc., depending on the type.
    address = ""

    # label - (Required) The label (e.g., "Work", "Mobile", etc.).
    label = ""

    # type - (Required) The contact method type. May be (`email_contact_method`, `phone_contact_method`, `sms_contact_method`, `push_notification_contact_method`).
    type = ""

    # user_id - (Required) The ID of the user.
    user_id = ""

    # send_short_email - (Optional) Send an abbreviated email message instead of the standard email output.
    send_short_email = ""

    # country_code - (Optional) The 1-to-3 digit country calling code. Required when using `phone_contact_method` or `sms_contact_method`.
    country_code = ""

    # Exported Attributes
    # "id" - The ID of the contact method.
    # "blacklisted" - If true, this phone has been blacklisted by PagerDuty and no messages will be sent to it.
    # "enabled" - If true, this phone is capable of receiving SMS messages.
}
pagerduty-resource-user-contact-method.description: A [contact method](https://v2.developer.pagerduty.com/v2/page/api-reference#!/Users/get_users_id_contact_methods) is a contact method for a PagerDuty user (email, phone or SMS).
